QuestionText: What is the primary concept of the Buddhist philosophy that deals with the cycle of birth, death, and rebirth?
In Christianity, what is the name of the document that is considered to be the inspired word of God?
Which of the following Hindu texts is considered the most sacred and authoritative?
In Islam, what is the name of the holy city to which Muslims turn during prayer and make a pilgrimage to at least once in their lifetime?
Who is the founder of the Sikh faith?
In Jainism, what is the term for the path to liberation that involves the avoidance of harm to all living beings?
What is the name of the Jewish holiday that commemorates the rededication of the Temple in Jerusalem during the Maccabean Revolt?
In Shintoism, what is the term for the spirits or deities that are believed to inhabit the natural world?
Who is the founder of the Baha'i faith?
In Taoism, what is the term for the ultimate reality or the fundamental principle of the universe?
